channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-8848] data loading from text files or text file processing doesn't handle nulls correctly
item.description:
I am not sure how nulls are supposed to be stored in text tables, but after loading some data with "null" or "NULL" strings, or x00 characters, we get bunch of annoying logging from LazyPrimitive that data is not in INT format and was converted to null, with data being "null" (string saying "null", I assume from the code).
Either load should load them as nulls, or there should be some defined way to load nulls.
item.summary: data loading from text files or text file processing doesn't handle nulls correctly

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: patch to make the annoying logging for this case less annoying, does not actually solve the problem

jpullokkaran ashutoshc this happens in tests when loading cbo t1,t2,t3 tables. Do you guys know about how nulls are supposed to work, and if they work as designed (which would be pretty ugly) can you please +1 the patch.

Overall: +1 all checks pass

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12681157/HIVE-8848.patch

SUCCESS: +1 6654 tests passed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12681157 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
I started seeing this in the logs as well
Nulls are supposed to be stored as a literal \N
You can re-submit and merge if I am wrong but in TextInputFormats null is '\N' I think this is defined in LazySimpleSerde
Fix the files instead

I think I've forgot to make an issue for this (attaching) patch for over a year. Ideally, nulls should be handled in ObjectInspector (see HIVE-594), but this just adds null flag to LazyNonPrimitive for my laziness.

Rebased to trunk. Not sure to pass all tests (it was based on hive-0.10.0).
